channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report X-2024040471
item.description:
Report X-2024040471

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-17T15:16:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package wet at top of box. 1 plastic bottle leaking fluid from broken lid. Around 12 fl oz of contents lost. Bottle unable to be resealed. DescribePack: Broken screw-on cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package removed from loaded vehicle

item.title: Report X-2024040267
item.description:
Report X-2024040267

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was visibly wet on the corner of the box. Upon further inspection there was no inner packaging, and the package was dropped causing the plastic on the top of the can to separate from the metal can and allowing the liquid to leak out. DescribePack: Plastic cap came apart from the metal can allowing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill tote and spill pads.

item.title: Report X-2024040253
item.description:
Report X-2024040253

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-15T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler observed a wet hazmat package. The package handler then notified manager. The manager secured the package in a plastic lined hazmat tote and delivered to QA. DescribePack: Loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was secured in a plastic lined Hazmat tote.
